issue.title: a.erase(q1, q2) unable to directly return q2

discussion.p: Section , Table 102, page 743 of the C++ 2011 Standard states that a.erase(q1, q2) returns q2. The problem is that a.erase(q1, q2) cannot directly return q2 as the return type, iterator, differs from that of q2, const_iterator.

li.p: In the specification of a.erase(q1, q2) in sub-clause , Table 102 change as indicated:

table.caption: Table 102 — Associative container requirements (in addition to container) (continued)

tr.td: erases all the elements in the range [q1,q2). Returns q2an iterator pointing to the same element as q2 or end() if q2 doesn't point to an element.
log(a.size()) + N where N has the value distance(q1, q2).
